abstract.text: Asks the delegate for a preview of the item at the specified index path when a context-menu interaction ends.

The configuration of the menu to dismiss.
The index path of the item where the menu dismissal occurs.
A targeted preview object corresponding to the item at the index path to use during the menuâ€™s dismissal animation.
The system calls this method when a context menu dismisses from the collection view. Implement this method to override the default dismissal preview that the collection view generates for the item at

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that manages an ordered collection of data items and presents them using customizable layouts.
The methods adopted by the object you use to manage user interactions with items in a collection view.
Asks the delegate for a preview of the item at the specified index path when a context-menu interaction ends.
Asks the delegate for a preview of the item at the specified index path when a context-menu interaction begins.
Asks the delegate for a context-menu configuration for the items at the specified index paths.
Informs the delegate when a context menu will appear.
Informs the delegate when a context menu will disappear.
Informs the delegate when a user triggers a commit by tapping the preview.
An object containing the configuration details for the contextual menu.
An object describing the view to use during preview-related animations.
Provide quick access to useful actions by adding context menus to your iOS app.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Adding context menus in your app

abstract.text: An object containing a list of indexes that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A list of indexes that together represent the path to a specific location in a tree of nested arrays.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
